pages.title: ⎧ King of Wands ⎧
pages.text: King of the Chariot of Fire$(br)       $(m)∆$() Air of ∆ Fire

The King of Wands uplifts a blossoming wand a symbol of new life and energy.$(br)  Emblazoned on the back of his throne is a salamander, a creature thought to walk though fire.$(br)  Like elemental Fire that gives life to all, his character is an example of intense generousness.$(br)  He sits at the edge of his royal seat, almost as if ready to stand up to articulate himself better.$(br)  He does not necessarily hold

the opinion about which he is so emphatic, always seeing both sides of every question.$(br)  He may be an extravagant jester, but he laughs at both himself and the subject of his jokes.$(br)  Like Fire can be explosive, he is swift and strong, and sometimes inclined to act on impulse; sometimes easily led by external influences, especially in trifles where they are easy prey to indecision.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Honesty, conscience.$(br)  May mean someone of great confidence, satisfied with their life; a natural leader.$(br)  Sometimes someone with a strong sense of art and beauty.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Impatience, brashness.$(br)  Sometimes a person who is charming, but maybe arrogant as well; they can be domineering.
